reference.title: The scope attribute
reference.shortdesc: The scope attribute identifies the closeness of the relationship between the current document and the target resource.

section.draft-comment: The "opens in new window" really is a processor choice but has been encoded in the spec from the beginning - should we drop that language? There is no reason for the spec to require that "external" opens in a new window, and I'm not sure that the spec should tie that behavior to this value.

ul.li: Set scope to local when the resource is part of the current set of content.

Set scope to peer when the resource is part of the current set of content but might not accessible at build time, or for maps to be treated as root maps for the purpose of creating map-to-map key references (peer maps). An implementation might open such resources in the same browser window to distinguish them from those with scope set to external.
Set scope to external when the resource is not part of the current information set and should open in a new browser window.

section.p: The processing default is determined by the value of the href attribute. In most cases, the processing default is local. However the processing default is external whenever the absolute URI in the href attribute begins with one of the following schemes:
Processors can consider additional URI schemes as external by default. Processors MUST always consider relative URIs as local by default.
